name: name
name of schema containing tabl: name of schema containing extended statistics objec

name: name
name of schema containing tabl: owner of the extended statistics objec

name: name[]
name of schema containing tabl: names of the columns included in the extended statistics objec

name: text[]
name of schema containing tabl: expressions included in the extended statistics objec

name: char[]
name of schema containing tabl: types of extended statistics object enabled for this recor

name: pg_ndistinct
name of schema containing tabl: n-distinct counts for combinations of column values. if greater than zero, the estimated number of distinct values in the combination. if less than zero, the negative of the number of distinct values divided by the number of rows. (the negated form is used when analyze believes that the number of distinct values is likely to increase as the table grows; the positive form is used when the column seems to have a fixed number of possible values.) for example, -1 indicates a unique combination of columns in which the number of distinct combinations is the same as the number of rows

name: text[]
name of schema containing tabl: a list of the most common combinations of values in the columns. (null if no combinations seem to be more common than any others.

name: bool[]
name of schema containing tabl: a list of null flags for the most common combinations of values. (null when most_common_vals is.

name: float8[]
name of schema containing tabl: a list of the frequencies of the most common combinations, i.e., number of occurrences of each divided by total number of rows. (null when most_common_vals is.

name: float8[]
name of schema containing tabl: a list of the base frequencies of the most common combinations, i.e., product of per-value frequencies. (null when most_common_vals is.
